FuncDef:
The accounting-copy radius-server command enables the system to send accounting packets of a domain to a configured RADIUS server group.
The undo accounting-copy radius-server command, you can cancel sending of accounting packets of a domain to a configured RADIUS server group.
By default, accounting packets of a domain are not sent to any RADIUS server group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a RADIUS server group.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters containing uppercase letters (A to Z), lowercase letters (a to z), numbers (0 to 9), punctuation mark ".", and conjunctive punctuation such as dash "-" and underline "_".

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can configure a RADIUS server group as an accounting RADIUS server in a domain. The cooperation or hierarchy mode may be adopted for network operation, which requires accounting bills to be sent to multiple parties. Accounting bills function as original accounting information and facilitate settlement. Hence, the accounting-copy radius-server command is provided to configure sending of accounting packets of a domain to a RADIUS server group.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
